decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of planning permission P/2021/1439, dated: 18/11/2021.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [insert plan numbers/documents].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0831, approved on 04/09/2023. 
 Reason: In order to protect the appearance of the area.
Condition : 4 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2024/1876, approved on 23/10/2024. 
 Reason: To ensure that secure cycle spaces are provided and retained for future occupiers.
Condition : 5 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2022/3780, approved on 08/02/2023. 
Reason: To ensure that the construction takes place in an acceptable manner and would not cause harm to neighbouring buildings or the wider area.
Condition : 6 - The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Statement received 05/05/2021, and achieve net 'Zero Carbon' emissions. 
Reason: To ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.
Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.
Reason: In order to protect and conserve water supplies and resources.
Condition : 8 - The developments shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:
�	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
�	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
�	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone. 
Reason: In order to ensure the sustainable sourcing of materials in the interests of environmental protection.
Condition : 9 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0831, approved on 04/09/2023. 
Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding at and from the site.
Condition : 10 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Reason: To ensure that the methods to mitigate the risk of surface water flooding have been implemented as agreed and that the drainage system is suitably managed.
Condition : 11 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2024/1876, approved on 23/10/2024. 
 Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance for the site.
Condition : 12 - Prior to the commencement of the development (excluding site investigation and demolition):
A.	The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0831, approved on 04/09/2023. 
B.	If required, a scheme for decontamination of the site shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, for written approval. The scheme shall account for any comments made by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is first occupied. During the course of the development;
C.	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues. Before the development is first brought into use;
D.	The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. The Local Planning Authority (LPA) therefore wishes to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety in accordance with policy EQ8 Contamination of the adopted Local Plan. 
Supporting notes: 
A.	An initial phase 1 desk study must be submitted with the original application and will include the aims and objectives, data collection, site reconnaissance (walk over survey), and development of the initial Conceptual Model (CM), which identifies all potential pollutant linkages on the site. The report should also make recommendations for the further gathering of information and or intrusive investigation. The full site investig
Condition : 13 - The development hereby permitted shall obtain a 'Secured by Design' certificate.
Reason: In order to promote a safer environment.
Condition : 14 - No part of the development herby approved shall be occupied until details have been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority for a scheme of acoustic insulation and any associated ventilation to ensure the maximum noise level to be permitted within dwellings with windows shut and any other necessary means of ventilation provided shall not exceed the "good" limits for bedrooms and "reasonable" for living rooms contained in BS8233:2014. These being LAeq,16hour = 40 dB in living rooms, and at night (07:00 - 23:00) LAeq,8hour = 30 dB and LAFmax = 45 dB in bedrooms, and a night LAeq,1hour = 45 dB in Kitchens, Bathrooms and Utility Rooms " for the part of the development in question. The details shall be carried out as approved.
Reason: To provide a good standard of living conditions for future occupiers.
Condition : 15 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (as amended) (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To protect neighbours' living conditions and the appearance of the area.
Condition : 16 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2024/1876, approved on 23/10/2024. 
 Reason:  To protect the appearance of the locality and neighbours' outlook and privacy.
description: Removal of condition 7 (monitoring of emissions) of planning permission 00442/E/P1 approved 18/11/2021 for the erection of six houses including associated cycle storage, landscaping, refuse and recycling storage following the demolition of the garages.
